oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Nashville Cats program - Andrea Zonn - 2017-06-17
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: Interview program on the life and career to date of Andrea Zonn from the Ford Theater at the Country Music Hall of Fame and Museum on June 17, 2017. Program hosted by Bill Lloyd. Includes audio from video and selected audio excerpts.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:creator: Andrea Zonn;
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dcterms:tableOfContents: (00:00) Walk-in music / (06:17) Opening comments by Abi Tapia / (13:55) Opening comments and Andrea Zonn introduction by Bill Lloyd / (15:18) Audio from video appearance of Vince Gill and Andrea on the Grand Ole Opry / (18:02) Opening comments from Andrea / (18:55) Andrea talks about her Mother and Father and their early days / (21:55) The importance and influence of growing up in Champagne Illinois and the University of Illinois / (22:42) First interest in violin and the first music she remembers / (24:00) Talks about the role of music in her family / (24:40) Talks about her music teachers / (26:00) Talks about her transition from classical to folk music and going to her first bluegrass music festival / (28:40) Original music that she played with her early bands / (29:20) Listening to music that her parents didn't like, moving to Nashville and spending time at the Station Inn club / (30:37) Violin and fiddle techniques complementing each other /

(31:09) Attending the University of Illinois at Urbana-Champaign and continuing her performing career / (32:37) Meeting Alison Krauss and becoming friends / (34:19) Tells story about attending fiddle contest in Winfield Kansas with Alison / (35:25) The first International Bluegrass Music Association conference and awards show / (36:15) Audio from video of all-girl bluegrass band appearance at the first IBMA show / (38:45) Recognition of Alison Brown in the audience / (39:01) Moving to Nashville and why / (40:50) Working with Brenda Lee and working at the Opryland amusement park / (42:35) Working with the band Big Dogs and Tony Trischka / (44:29) Audio from Big Dogs Live at the Birchmere program / (45:45) How she and Vince Gill met, advice she received from Tony Trischka and joining Gill's band and her first master recording session work with Vince / (48:48) Vince Gill audio excerpts / (50:41) Going back to Vanderbilt Blair School of Music to finish her degree /
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:subject: Zonn, Andrea; Country Music Hall of Fame & Museum (Nashville, Tenn.);
